title: Please just remove chat
body:
Please just remove chat in game in general, 95% of the time its only used for toxididty, so y removing the ability for people to abuse eachother, its harder for them to get distracted and throw games by fighting, 90% of fights happen over a ks, death or mistake, if they cant complain, there wont be a fight. Problem solved, done and done, makes the community in general less toxic as well.

Don't try to deny it, because you know its true.

replies.body: I rarely have a problem with chat aye probably because i usually play with mates... We just shiat talk each other in skype.

But..but...then how would you meet the awesome people who you'd love to duo/party with for the rest of your league life?:( How would you plan out strategies and teamfights? How would you get tips on a certain champ when you're new to them? And if people can't complain, wouldn't that encourage ksing and etc.? Maybe I'm just lucky but I've only met 1 person so far who's pushed my buttons, everyone else is really nice or obviously just had a bad day(in which case I try to cheer them up and it works...).

Completely removing chat would be way too harsh, part of the reason I love league is because every game I get to make new friends and learn new things from teammates or even enemies, if people are smart enough they can just mute...

Communication wins games:D

Ps. Also how would u ask that noob adc to ward river? Vision also wins games:P

"can you please buy a pink ward adc"

"Fuck off you little %%%% your support that your fucking job so shut the fuck up and do your own fucking shit" is the response i get 99.98% of the time when i ask them nicely.

> "Fuck off you little %%%% your support that your fucking job so shut the fuck up and do your own fucking shit" is the response i get 99.98% of the time when i ask them nicely.

Awww I feel really sorry for you!:( I guess I really am lucky...most adcs have been pretty awesome in my games xD There was 1 game tho when they were being rather difficult...the conversation went something like this:

Me: Hey adc could u buy some wards plz?:333
Adc: no...isn't that your job?
Me: Well partly yes haha:P But could you buy one pretty please?:3 It would help us a lot in reking bot and give you loads more kills by catching people offguard!;) You can even pull off some fancy tricks like stealing drag!!!:D Vision wins games! 
Adc: well i guess so...

I supposed you just have to cater to their interests(something like that), everyone loves getting kills and pulling off fancy plays, use wards as an example of how they can do that!:D

If they're still being stubborn tho, there's not much you can do. I have to keep reminding myself all the time that I can only control my character in the game, so just do your best and don't let the whole' ugh wtf stupid adc wont ward ' thing get into your brain coz it'll probably make you perform worse. 

Gl in not getting matched up with any trolls!:) 

Ps. If you remove chat, that '0.02%' chance of your adc listening will be down to 0% since you can't even tell them...

Here's an answer to a similar question quoted straight from Riot Lyte:

+ _"This is actually a great question.
We agree, chat COULD be non-essential, and we could start building the systems and tools to completely replace chat, such as the feature you mentioned of putting in short-cuts to automate messages, or systems like the "chat" system in Hearthstone. However, our design philosophy is to not completely remove a feature just because there is a potential for toxicity--we always assess the pros and cons, and try to see if we can figure out a design that is net positive. For example, although there is far less verbal toxicity in a game of Hearthstone, there's also less meaningful interactions and dialogue. In some games that remove chat, it's even hard to tell whether you are playing versus an AI or a human and that makes a difference in your connection with the game. It's nearly impossible to get to know someone without being able to express yourself organically through conversation, and if that's impossible, it's really hard to make friends. We were just reviewing data today that a majority of players have made a real, online friend in League and play with them a decent number of games a month--that's awesome. We think there is huge value in chat and some of our best experiences are those matches where you're chatting it up in games and become friends after._

 _To us, that positive experience is so valuable that it was worth trying features like Chat Restrictions and All-Chat Filters to try to reduce  the negativity of chat, while still keeping the benefits."_

Source is right [here](https://ask.fm/RiotLyte/answers/133551494594), in case you're interested.
